column4: Can anyone guide me through installing vino from edgy-proposed?
if you have the .deb, sudo dpkg -i vino*.deb
I don't have the .deb, i don't know how to get it : )
is -proposed in sources.list?
I added proposed to the end of "... edgy main restricted..."
i have not used -proposed myself, but if so, i would imagine you would just sudo apt-get install vino
in sources.list
wait, i think you have an error in syntax there, let me clarify
when i did apt-get update it failed on proposed, i'm not sure it exists
okay, cool, error confirmed :)
deb http://gb.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu edgy main restricted universe multiverse proposed
revert to your former sources.list, you had an "edgy main..." line, right?
yeah
take off proposed, then sudo apt-get update, to confirm the file is good at that point
it is, it actually failed on proposed
Unable to find expected entry  proposed/binary-i386/Packages in Meta-index file
then *duplicate* that entire line, and turn "edgy" into "edgy-proposed"
ahhhhh : )
the original line should *not* have proposed at the end, just so i'm clear about that
yup, kk, testing
sudo apt-get update, to confirm the file is good at that point
It's good and your a hero : ) Let me see if I can install vino now
oh no, it says vino is at newest version
This bug (https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+source/vino/+bug/65795) seems to say it is updated (fixed) in proposed.
